response.improvementExplanation: The repartition(3) operation is used to increase the number of partitions to 3. However, in this context, reducing the partitions using coalesce() can be more efficient as it avoids a full shuffle when decreasing the number of partitions.
response.benefits: Switching to coalesce(3) from repartition(3) will reduce shuffling overhead, improve resource utilization, and potentially lead to faster job execution.
